subject: Physical Fitness
title: Knees Over Toes Myth
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Knees Over Toes Myth.

hook.text: Never let your knees pass your toes â€” the most repeated gym cue in history. And it's wrong.

buildup.text: This myth originated from a 1978 study that measured knee forces during squats. It was widely misinterpreted.

discovery.text: Restricting forward knee travel increases hip and lower back stress by up to 1,000%. The load has to go somewhere.

twist.text: Walking downstairs pushes your knees far past your toes. Your body is designed for this range of motion.

climax.text: Knees over toes is normal biomechanics. Strong knees in full range are healthy knees, not damaged ones.

punchline.text: Let your knees move naturally. Restricting them just redirects stress.

quiz.question: What happens when you restrict knees from passing toes during a squat?
options: Hip and lower back stress increases dramatically
The exercise becomes safer for all joints
